Creating a custom action (via a button)
''A
custom action
can be ensured by the analyst depending on the business logic implemented.'' This allows you to display a button for special action in the System object profile and/or registry. At the moment, the System provides a wide range of actions to configure (displaying buttons in the profile and registry).
See details here
.
To create a new custom action, you need to:
1. Go to the register of
Actions
(
more about working with the registry
), click
. The System will display the action parameters.
2. Specify parameters for the new action.
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the action name. This name is usually assigned to the action button. You can override the name when you configure the associated object type (for more information, refer to point 4).
Action type
Choosing the type of the action generated. Possible values:
Action (button)
Folder (a drop-down list to select actions), it is used to optimize the location of items in the profile/registry
Parent action
Defining a parent action. It is often used to display buttons from a drop-down list.
System identifier
Entering/viewing the ID number of the action generated. The field can be filled in automatically.
System order
Entering/viewing the system number of the action generated. The field can be filled in automatically.
Hint
Defining a hint/a tip that will be displayed when hovering over the button.
System JS module identifier
Entering the system ID of the JS module. If the User interface module is not specified, the value is required in this field.
User interface module
Choosing a module (a set of settings to ensure the required platform functionality) from the drop-down list. Some modules activate additional fields to configure an action in the
Action additional parameters
. For example, after selecting the
Call algorithm
module, you need to create/specify the algorithm called. For more information, refer to point 3.
Action additional parameters
Creating/selecting additional parameters of the action. Different parameters are defined depending on the specified
user action module
. Described below (point 3).
Visibility. Examples of displaying actions are provided at the end of the article.
Show in registry
Determine whether a custom button can be displayed in the registry control panel.
Show in profile
Determine whether a custom button can be displayed in the object profile control panel.
Show in LocalObject
Determine whether a custom button can be displayed in the child object profile control panel.
Related object types
Object types
Defining the object type from which the action is configured. The setting contains a number of parameters described below (point 4).
Additional attributes
Action options
Defining/entering action options.
3. Define additional action parameters. To do this, click the
. button. After saving additional parameters, the button in the
Additional parameters
block of fields will change to
. The required parameters depend on the user interface module selected. The following describes the parameters of the most common user interface modules.
3.1. If you select the
Call algorithm
module, you need to specify:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering/viewing the setting name.
Algorithm
Entering/selecting the algorithm from the list.
Open object profile
Defining how to open the object profile. The System allows you to open an object profile that has not yet been saved (that is, the decision to save the object is expected from the end user). To open the profile, the algorithm must return the required object: "return". In this case, the System will open a profile of the object specified (which is created and filled in in the algorithm). Otherwise, the result of the work is a profile of the object the algorithm is running for.
How to open the object profile
Defining how to open the object profile. Possible options:
In modal window
In new window
In this window
Visual
Selecting the visual for the object profile to be opened. The field is active if
Yes
is selected in the previous field.
Save object
Defining whether the current object can be saved.
Lock the object profile
Defining whether the current object profile can be locked for editing.
Examples of actions of the
Call algorithm
module are: creating an order, creating a new contract, e-mail notification of new and/or overdue tasks.
3.2. If you choose the
Run a business process module (without selecting from the list of available ones)
, you need to specify:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering/viewing the setting name.
Relation of process and object type
Choosing the relation of the process and object type (more
about it
) from the drop-down list.
Process
Choosing a business process (more
about it
) from the drop-down list.
Examples of actions in the
Run a business process
module are: approval of the sales terms and conditions, agreement of vacation, checking the client’s reliability.
3.3. If you select the
Copy data
module, you need to specify:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering/viewing the setting name.
Copy items
Defining the copy items (attributes) (
see details here
).
Save after copying
Defining whether the copied data can be saved.
Examples of actions of the
Copy data
module are: approval of the sales terms and conditions, agreement of vacation, checking the client’s reliability.
A detailed use case how to make settings
.
4. Select the object type in which profile the custom action should be performed. To define the object type, click the
button in the
Related object types
. The System will display the parameters profile.
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering/viewing the setting name.
Algorithm of action visibility in the child object
Selecting/entering an algorithm from the drop-down list that defines whether the button is visible in child object types.
Actions
Selecting an action from the drop-down list.
System attribute object type
Defining the object type in which profile the custom action button will be displayed.
Override the action name
Entering the button name (if required). By default, the button name is defined by the action name.
Override the action options
Entering the action options for the object type given (if required). By default, the configured action options are taken into account (point 2).
Override the action parameters
Entering/overriding the additional parameters for the action. By default, additional action parameters (point 2) are taken into account, depending on the user interface module applied.
Override the action hint
Entering a hint/a tip that will be displayed when hovering over the button. By default, the configured action hint is used (point 2).
5. Save the profile of the
Action
using
.
Depending on the settings of
action visibility
, they are displayed:
In the registry. For example, in the Monitoring factors registry; for more information, refer to
registry settings
In the object profile. For example in the task profile
In the control panel of the child object representation. For example, when displaying the LocalObject represented by the File object type
The button can also be configured using the
Widgets
button. This allows you to set the width of the button and place an icon on it. In this case, the action is created in the way described here.
